case_title: MOTOR AND GENERAL SALES (P.) LTD. vs COMMISSIONER OF INCOME TAX
complaint_summary: The assessee claimed deductions for losses incurred due to repossession of vehicles financed under hire purchase agreements, which were disallowed by the Income-tax Officer.
investigation_summary: The vehicles repossessed were registered in the names of the hire-purchasers, and the Tribunal determined that they could not be considered as part of the assessee's stock-in-trade.
judgment_summary: The court held that the vehicles repossessed by the assessee were not part of its stock-in-trade and the losses claimed could not be deducted under section 28 of the Income-tax Act, 1961. However, the losses were allowed as bad debts under section 36(1)(vii) read with section 36(2). The reference was answered in the affirmative against the assessee.
Decision_or_verdict: Question answered in affirmative and against the assessee.
legal_arguments: Vehicles registered in the names of hire-purchasers cannot be considered as stock-in-trade.
Losses claimed under section 28 are not maintainable.
Losses allowed as bad debts under section 36(1)(vii) read with section 36(2).
key_issues: Allowability of losses as bad debts under section 36.
Applicability of section 28 for trading loss deductions.

legal_terms.Hire Purchase: A system by which a buyer pays for goods in regular installments while having use of the goods.

words_and_phrases.Stock-in-trade: Goods or assets held by a business for sale or use in its operations.

summary_vector_notes: The case revolves around the allowability of losses claimed by the assessee due to repossession of vehicles financed under hire purchase agreements. The court ruled that the vehicles were not part of the assessee's stock-in-trade and disallowed deductions under section 28 but allowed them as bad debts under section 36(1)(vii) read with section 36(2).

legal_issues.question: Whether the trucks financed on hire purchase basis constituted the assessee's stock-in-trade and whether there could be a loss on account of their revaluation?
Whether the assessee's claim fell under section 36(1)(vii) read with section 36(2) and not as a trading loss under section 28?
legal_issues.tribunal_ruling: Claim considered under section 36(1)(vii) read with section 36(2).

legal_issues.question: Whether the debts in question had become bad during the accounting year under consideration?
legal_issues.tribunal_ruling: Debts had not become bad during the accounting year.

tribunal_findings.ownership: Vehicles registered in names of hire-purchasers under Motor Vehicles Act, 1939.
tribunal_findings.loss_deduction: Allowed under section 36(1)(vii) read with section 36(2) as bad debt.

precedent.principle: Vehicles registered in names of hire-purchasers cannot be considered stock-in-trade.
